9.30.17  12:08 pm   I know this is probably a tough question, but do you have any tips on writing melodies? If you give me a melody, I can arrange it (figure out harmonies, bass line, drum beats etc)... but I always hear people say that melodies just 'come to them', like they just appear out of nowhere in their heads like magic... but this has never been the case for me. I usually write a chord pattern that I think sounds interesting, then I try to build a melody from the notes in the chords. Sometimes I can do it, sometimes I can't. But I know I'm doing it backwards. Melody should come first. Melody is the most important part of a song.
9.30.17  11:58 am   Your first song I'm stuck in a Rut states that you are indeed stuck in a rut. Are you still stuck in that rut?

9.30.17  11:56 am   9.29.17  9:32 pm I checked with the committee. They told me that they register songs once they are accepted as music. But they're not the ones to determine rather or not something is accepted as music. They told me to refer to you in order to get my Certificate of Acceptance... which I will then have to bring back to them, in order to officially register something as music.
